reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night en route to Cornwall. The working farm is located deep in the Devon Countryside close to Exeter and Dartmoor. We were welcomed warmly and provided with tea and biscuits in the garden whilst we watched the farmer bringing in his hay crop.
reviews.title: Lovely stop in the Devon countryside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was large and had high quality soft furnishings. The en suite shower room contained all we needed. We were able to use cutlery and crockery from the breakfast room as we had provided ourselves with a light supper.
reviews.title: Like staying in a family home in the countryside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good and the owner was helpful in providing information on places to visit as we travelled across Dartmoor.
reviews.title: Very welcoming and comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying for a weekend wasn't long enough - we were well looked after, comfortable and had brilliant views of the countryside.
reviews.title: Lovely stay on a working farm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B is on a working farm and the whole family were there to chip in and make us feel welcome. It felt like we were staying in a room in their home. The owners were very friendly and helpful, offering us advice where to go on our days out and directions to the best pubs in the area.
reviews.title: Peerless; friendly family and an immaculate room, superb breakfasts!
